WorkItem.Description:
Tried switching from 'spellstone' to 'firestone' in my buff options and got this pop up:
 
[Arg_IndexOutOfRangeException]
Arguments:
Debugging resource strings are unavailable. Often the key and arguments provide sufficient information to diagnose the problem. See http://go.microsoft.com/fwlink/?linkid=106663&Version=3.0.50106.0&File=mscorlib.dll&Key=Arg_IndexOutOfRangeException

Comments.Message: This isnt fixed, i had the same problem when loading my lock.
Menicejoe, it is fixed, by r50050. Pay more attention, please.
Not fixed, same trouble on my warlock (v 2.3.17.0)
It HAS been fixed - but only in the source code - either downlad the source and compile a new version, or wait for the next release (2.3.18) sometime this week.

Sfullak - I assume when you say "2.3.17" what you really mean is "the most recent version of Rawr3."  But those are not the same thing at all.  When using Rawr 2, no matter what version, you should not get that error.  And for a warlock, you're going to want to stick with Rawr 2 for now, as mentioned in a couple other places.

I've had the same error with the online version on http://elitistjerks.com/rawr.php. I'm rather going to wait for a fix. Made my day when I found the Website and could get around installing another tool on my PC.
bumping AGAIN cuz people are dumb
If it's fixed, then why am I still getting this error when loading my Warlock character?

Because you don't read? This is fixed in our source code. When a new version is posted, you will not encounter the error anymore. That's how software development works. You find a bug, we fix it, then we give you a new copy of the program, and it stops being broken. It doesn't just magically stop being broken.
You posted new versions since june...
